DOCNAME: BISERICA SFANTUL HARALAMBIE AND OTHERS v. MOLDOVA
TEXT: PERSON ( ORG , hereinafter “ the applicant church ” ) , is a church registered in GPE . The second , third , fourth and fifth applicants ( Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON ) are NORP nationals , were born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively and they live in GPE . All applicants are represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicants , may be summarised as follows .

By a decision of DATE , the ORG decided to return to the applicant church a church building together with CARDINAL auxiliary buildings and to repair the church . The restitution and repair was to be carried out within DATE of the decision . However , the authorities only partly complied : the church was returned but not repaired and none of the auxiliary houses were returned .

In DATE the applicant church addressed ORG for ORG which , in turn , requested the ORG to comply with their decision . There was no response so the applicant church took proceedings in ORG . On DATE that court rejected the action because they had failed to attempt to resolve the issue by addressing the Government directly . The applicant church appealed to ORG claiming that it had not been properly summoned to the hearing ( so it was not represented there ) and that ORG had missed the DATE deadline for summarily rejecting its application but nevertheless decided on the admissibility of the claim without giving it the opportunity to modify its application or present supporting documents or arguments . On DATE ORG held a hearing at which the applicant was present and rejected its appeal .
The applicant church then addressed the Government directly . The latter responded that implementation of the DATE decision was the responsibility of the municipality .

The applicant church then took a new action against the Government in ORG . On DATE that court found that it was not competent but that the first instance ordinary courts were : the complaint was not about the DATE decision itself but rather about the action and inaction of the authorities implementing it . The applicant church was not represented at the hearing because , it claims , it was not properly summoned . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant church 's appeal . The applicant was represented at ORG hearing .
The applicant church did not initiate further proceedings .
The relevant provisions of LAW in force at the relevant time read as follows :
“ Article CARDINAL :
ORG :

CARDINAL ) judges as a first instance court proceedings against actions of the authorities of the central public administration and of their officials done in violation of the law or in excess of competence and which violate the rights of citizens ;
Article CARDINAL : Acceptance for examination and refusal to examine civil law suits
The judge determines whether a civil action is to be accepted for examination .
The judge shall refuse to receive an action :

CARDINAL ) if the interested person who filed the action did not complete the pre - trial settlement procedure through the use of extra - judicial means or the procedure established by law for the particular type of action ;
CARDINAL ) if the court is not competent to examine the case ;
Article CARDINAL : Powers of the court of appeal
The court of appeal has the power :
CARDINAL ) to reject the appeal and maintain the judgment , finding or decision ; or
CARDINAL ) to accept the appeal .
The relevant provisions of ORG in force at the relevant time read :
“ LAW The object of an action in administrative law
( CARDINAL ) The failure to resolve , within the period prescribed by law , a query regarding a right recognised by law may itself constitute the object of an action in administrative law .
